thread.title: British daredevil who climbed Wembley Arch quizzed by police in Dubai
thread.title_full: British daredevil who climbed Wembley Arch quizzed by police in Dubai

author: Fiona Simpson
title: British daredevil who climbed Wembley Arch quizzed by police in Dubai
text:
Sunday 5 March 2017 22:26 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Police questioning: Daredevil James Kingston was hauled before police in Dubai YouTube/EE 
A British free-runner who once scaled Wembley Stadium has been quizzed by police in Dubai over stunts performed in the city. 
James Kingston, 26, told 33.4k Twitter followers that he had been “plucked from his hotel room with no warning by four undercover agents” on Saturday. 
The urban adventurer shares videos with fans on YouTube him scale huge skyscrapers and cranes across the world. 
Mr Kingston, whose heart-stopping videos have been viewed millions of times online, was the first person to climb the iconic arch of Wembley Stadium in north London. 
Shocking footage captured by the stuntman showed stunning panoramic views of the capital from 440ft above the pitch at the 90,000-capacity venue. 
His most recent video showed Mr Kingston shimmy over a fence at a construction site in downtown Dubai in broad daylight. I have been arrested by the CID here in Dubai. Four undercover agents plucked me from my hotel room earlier today with no warning... pic.twitter.com/xdqKNLhijT — James Kingston (@JamesLKingston) March 4, 2017 
The state-owned newspaper Emarat Al Youm quoted Dubai police Brigadier General Salem Khalifa al-Rumaithi on Sunday confirming police had "summoned" Kingston over recent climbs. Eiffel Tower: James Kingston scaled the iconic French landmark (Youtube) 
Al-Rumaithi said Kingston previously had been arrested in 2014 after climbing to the top of the Princess Tower in Dubai Marina, which at over 400 metres (1,300 feet) is the second-tallest building in Dubai. Read more
